data.title: Eden for a boy?
data.meta_description:
What do you think about Eden for a boy?

Other names in the line up are:
Reuben
Elias
Ezra (OH isn‚Äôt a big fan)
data.text:
@TeddyBeans see I'm looking at my husband picturing him being called Eden.....then thinking about other grown men in my family seeing if they would suit that name....nope... please don't name a poor child this name Op

DS has a (male) friend called Eden. I think it is absolutely lovely - and would suit either a child or an adult.

I think Reuben is way too common now and Elias and Ezra a bit ‚Äútry hard‚Äù biblical. I can offer you Jotham as an alternative?

No, and I don't really like it for a girl. It's OK as a surname or name for a garden centre.

Reuben - it's not awful but gets misspelt as Rueben, and has the alternative spellings of Rubin and Ruben. Blends into all the R names that are currently popular.

Elias - a bit too long and vowelly for my taste. blends in with all El- names that are everywhere

Ezra - I can't see the appeal at all.

I can see it working on a blonde little surfer dude, who grows up to be a tree surgeon or outdoor pursuits leader. I think it‚Äôs lovely.

but if you have a little Mark Corrigan, maybe not so apt

Eden for a boy is fine. I'd pair it with an obv masculine name in the middle. People adjust to what they know. Reuben is also lovely

It's traditionally a boys name.

Not very classy for a girl.

I know an eighteen year old Eden and it really suits him.

I like it but I think it would get mistaken for aiden (which Is boring af) depending on your accent and where you live!

reuben is a sandwich üòÇ Elias to me just doesn‚Äôt sound nice, a bit sci fi maybe?

Ezras nice but then there‚Äôs George Ezra (again boring af!)

I must say when I hear Eden it sounds much more like a boys name than a girls name! But I know of girl Edens, just maybe not the prettiest name..?
